DataElement.preferredName: Biopsy Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Anatomic Site Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the biopsy site, removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from a named location of or within the body, of an acute graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract that has an onset within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biopsy Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the biopsy site, removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from a named location of or within the body, of an acute graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract that has an onset within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Anatomic Site
Property.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
